verses.text: Give thanks to the Lord; for \add he is\add* good: for his mercy \add endures\add* for ever.
Let now the house of Israel say, that \add he is\add* good: for his mercy \add endures\add* for ever.
Let now the house of Aaron say, that \add he is\add* good: for his mercy \add endures\add* for ever.
Let now all that fear the Lord say, that \add he is\add* good: for his mercy \add endures\add* for ever.
I called on the Lord out of affliction: and he listened to me, \add so as to bring me\add* into a wide place.
\x + \xo 117:6 \xt Heb 13:6 \x* The Lord is my helper; and I will not fear what man shall do to me.
The Lord is my helper; and I shall see \add my desire\add* upon my enemies.
\add It is\add* better to trust in the Lord than to trust in man.
\add It is\add* better to hope in the Lord, than to hope in princes.
All nations compassed me about: but in the name of the Lord I repulsed them.
They completely compassed me about: but in the name of the Lord I repulsed them.
They compassed me about as bees \add do\add* a honeycomb, and they burst into flame as fire among thorns: but in the name of the Lord I repulsed them.
I was thrust, and sorely shaken, that I might fall: but the Lord helped me.
The Lord is my strength and my song, and is become my salvation.
The voice of exultation and salvation is in the tabernacles of the righteous: the right hand of the Lord has wrought mightily.
The right hand of the Lord has exalted me: the right hand of the Lord has wrought powerfully.
I shall not die, but live, and recount the works of the Lord.
The Lord has chastened me sore: but he has not given me up to death.
Open to me the gates of righteousness: I will go into them, and give praise to the Lord.
This is the gate of the Lord: the righteous shall enter by it.
I will give thanks to you; because you have heard me, and are become my salvation.
\x + \xo 117:22 \xt Matt 21:42 \x* The stone which the builders rejected, the same is become the head of the corner.
This has been done of the Lord; and it is wonderful in our eyes.
This is the day which the Lord has made: let us exult and rejoice in it.
O Lord, save now: O Lord, send now prosperity.
\x + \xo 117:26 \xt Matt 21:9 \x* Blessed is he that comes in the name of the Lord: we have blessed you out of the house of the Lord.

God is the Lord, and he has shined upon us: celebrate the feast with \f + \fr 117:27 \ft Possibly, the multitude, \fl q. d. \ft c≈ìtu frequenti. \f* thick \add branches, binding the victims\add* even to the horns of the altar.
You are my God, and I will give you thanks: you are my God, and I will exalt you. I will give thanks to you, for you have heard me, and are become my salvation.
Give thanks to the Lord; for he is good: for his mercy \add endures\add* for ever.
